intro: Banisteria campestris, commonly known as the creeping banister, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy pink or red flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Banisteria campestris is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
